pageTitle: Prime Minister’s itinerary for Tuesday, April 20, 2021 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Ottawa, Ontario

Private meetings.

10:45 a.m. The Prime Minister, joined by the Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Finance Chrystia Freeland, will virtually meet with a group of front-line pharmacists from across the country to discuss the ongoing vaccination efforts in the fight against COVID‑19.

The meeting will be streamed live on the Prime Minister’s official Twitter account: https://twitter.com/CanadianPM.

Note for media:

  • Restricted pooled photo opportunity

12:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will hold a media availability. He will be joined by the Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Finance Chrystia Freeland.

Room 200
Sir John A. Macdonald Building
144 Wellington Street

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media wishing to cover the event must be accredited with the Parliamentary Press Gallery.
  • Journalists can dial in to listen and ask questions.
  • Participant dial-in numbers:
    Local: 613-954-9003
    Toll-free: 1-866-206-0153
    Pass code: 6822783#

2:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend Question Period.

4:35 p.m. The Prime Minister will virtually visit Trans-Herbe Inc., a medium-sized business in Saint-Bruno-de-Montarville, Quebec. They will discuss how the COVID-19 pandemic has affected small and medium-sized businesses, and government supports that will advance economic recovery and growth.

Note for media:

  • Restricted pooled coverage

Media appearance

5:45 p.m. An interview with the Prime Minister will air live on Real Talk with Ryan Jespersen.
